content.description: This is the right most line, The problem starts about 5 feet to the right of the center unnamed problem. Go up using the best holds you can and top out and down climb on the slab. If you are on the right arete you have traversed too far right and you are doing a different variation of the problem.
content.location: The right line on the south face

content.description: This problem start about 5 feet from the left face of the south face. This is the most center line going up the face. Go up on fairly good hold to the top and top out.

This a wonderful problem! Stand start on the far left side of the south face. Follow the good holds till you get to the top and top out. Down climb is the slab on the left.

Enjoy
content.location: This climb is on the south face and on the far left side almost on the arete.

content.description: Stand start on the shelf right of the tree and climb up the fun features directly in front of the tree.
content.protection: A pad for mental support and a long sleeve shirt to hug the tree if you fall.
content.location: This line walks up the small fun features in front of the tree. If you continue left of the tree, you are on a VB downclimb that is also fun, but easier and not as sketchy.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand jug close to the left arete. Stand up to sidepulls and a blocky feature. Use jugs to continue up and topout.
content.location: This line goes up the right side of the west arete on the uphill side of the Microbus Boulder.

content.description: Short Campus problem. Start matched on some slopers and get the lip. Some side pulls and crimps on the top to make the top out. Might have to fold a pad to get in the start holds.
content.location: Left side of the middle of Micro Bus on the trail side.

content.description: Sit or stand start on right arete. Gain the lip of the boulder and traverse left with poor footholds and heelhooks. A calf hook bat hang might help. Bring your chalkbag with you on this one!
content.protection: A few pads to protect the crux or a spotter to move pads.
content.location: This traverses the east face of the Micro Bus Boulder.

content.description: Stand start with and undercling and step up to crimps and a sloping diagonal feature. crimp straight up to jugs and topout.
content.location: The line starts about six feet right of the uphill west arete of Microbus Boulder.
